Not content to rest on his laurels, former Genzyme chief Henri Termeer is staying busy as a tireless advocate for the Mass. biotech industry.

Christmas trees’ tales only half over

More than 100 tons of trees are gathered from curbs and brought to Boston’s composting site, where they wait to be chopped up by a giant grinder.

Halfway through a make-or-break school year for the embattled school there is a promising sign: Boston’s English High School has a drumline.

The MFA is famous around the world for its Asian collection, but a flurry of recent activity has attracted renewed attention to the museum’s Asian treasures.

Health & Wellness

Roe v. Wade 40 years later

Tuesday marks the 40th anniversary of the Supreme Court’s ruling on Roe v. Wade that struck down many state and federal restrictions on abortions, and it’s a perfect time to reflect on how women’s reproductive health issues have changed since then.

News

Cardinals Hall of Famer Musial dies

Stan Musial, one of baseball’s greatest hitters, died yesterday at the age of 92, the St. Louis Cardinals said. He helped the team capture three World Series championships in the 1940s.

'Amour'
